text: hello this is kit Eaton for the New York
Times if I said POW zap Walker splat I'm
really certain it'll make you think of
classic comic books but if you spend
five dollars on iOS app Comic Life you
can make your own comic books in a nap
with as many kersplat exclamations over
the fight scenes as you like comic life
is one of a number of comic making apps
but designed to take photos you've
already taken and turn them into cartoon
strips thereby saving you the bother of
doing all that tricky pen-and-ink
artwork the traditional comics require
comic life is my favorite of these apps
because it makes it very easy to take a
photo and apply one of a number of
different effects to the photo to make
it look just as if it was printed in a
comic and then add speech bubbles and
exclamations and so on and then you can
share it online the app does have a
slightly confusing menu layout like you
soon master it comics tripit pro is a
very similar Android app that's equally
powerful and which has a slightly more
fun and amazing interface the pro
version of comic strip it which is all
the features unlocked costs a dollar
there's also a free version so you can
try it before you buy it if you're not
sure about either of these comic making
apps strip designer a three dollar iOS
app is a good alternative it comes
pre-loaded with lots of different layout
for the story cells to make up your
comic and you can edit them to suit your
storytelling needs they gone there's
lots of positive reviews on the app
stores but it's plain interface isn't
quite to my taste still for three
dollars it's great value and it's
probably a great tool to let your
creative imagination run riot and on
that note I'm going to zap off into the
digital mists and make a comic strip for
my kids bye
Oh
